item.title: Karin Dalziel on "Alternatives to Cocoon?"
item.dc:creator: Karin Dalziel
item.description: I have used Cocoon to publish TEI encoded XML files processed with XSLT (using Saxon), but I have never tried any other method of processing/publishing files. What alternatives are there? For many sites we generally use only a very small subsets of the features in cocoon - some basic redirecting and post processing.

item.title: TimC on "How can I plot multiple sea journeys onto a digital map?"
item.dc:creator: TimC
item.description:
Hello there,

As part of a proposed project I have in mind to create a digital map, showing multiple sea journeys - i.e. information upon the individuals involved in that journey, the dates it began and ended, the name of the ship, and to plot it route on the map. Most journeys begin in eastern Australia, but the destinations are global.

I've had a brief play around with Google Maps which might suit the purpose, but doesn't seem ideal for working with sea journeys or the amount of data I plan to input for each voyage.

Is anyone aware of any software which might be a better fit?

Thanks for your help, and apologies for my ignorance.

Tim
